meanings.definition: An object believed to bring good luck or protection.
meanings.sent1: Carrying his lucky talisman made him feel safe.
meanings.sent2: She wore a talisman around her neck for good luck.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the shiny talisman was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a talisman, bringing joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The old man's talisman glowed softly in the moonlight, warding off evil spirits.

meanings.definition: Something producing apparently magical or miraculous effects.
meanings.sent1: The magician's talisman made objects disappear.
meanings.sent2: The potion had a talismanic effect on the sick child.
meanings.sent3: The talisman seemed to make time slow down around it.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a talisman, captivating all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The talismanic ring granted the wearer the power of invisibility.
